intro: Senecio bipinnatifidus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, narrow leaves that are deeply lobed. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
